title: Adverb collection 1
sentences: I always have coffee with milk for breakfast.
She speaks very slowly because I am learning.
My house is very close to the subway station.
The cat is sleeping inside the box.
Walk faster or we are going to arrive late.
Today I feel well and I have a lot of energy.
I can't hear you; speak louder please.
The book is on top of (up on) the living room table.
Your dog is always outside in the garden.
We are quite tired after the trip.
voy al cine los domingos por la tarde.
I often go to the cinema on Sunday afternoons.
I still haven't finished my homework.
has comido o quieres ir al restaurante?
Have you already eaten or do you want to go to the restaurant?
See you soon at the birthday party.
del centro y necesito el coche.
I live far from the center and I need the car.
The remote is underneath the sofa.
de la puerta para no olvidarlas.
Put the keys in front of the door so you don't forget them.
The garden is behind the house.
You speak Spanish better than last year.
Today I slept worse than yesterday because of the noise.
I have too much work this week.
I only want a little bit of sugar in my tea.
I did it this way (like that) because I didn't know another way.
mañana haga sol en la playa.
Probably tomorrow it will be sunny at the beach.
We arrived early and the museum is closed.
You always arrive late to our appointments.
vivo en Madrid pero soy de Londres.
Currently I live in Madrid but I am from London.
Can you wait here for a moment?
Your brother is over there waiting in the car.
he terminado de limpiar la cocina.
I have almost finished cleaning the kitchen.
tengo cinco euros en mi cartera.
I only have five euros in my wallet.
The exam was really difficult for us.
Open the gift carefully; it's fragile.
me gusta la pizza de jamón.
I finished the work quickly to leave earlier.
dictionary:
Siempre - Always
Nunca - Never
A veces - Sometimes
Despacio - Slowly
Rápido - Quickly
Cerca - Near / Close
Lejos - Far
Dentro - Inside
Fuera - Outside
Arriba - Up / On top
Abajo - Down / Below
Fuerte - Loudly / Strong
Bastante - Quite / Enough
A menudo - Often
Todavía - Still / Yet
Ya - Already
Pronto - Soon / Early
Debajo - Underneath
Delante - In front
Detrás - Behind
Mejor - Better
Peor - Worse
Demasiado - Too much
Poco - Little / A bit
Así - Like this / Like that
Probablemente - Probably
Temprano - Early
Tarde - Late
Actualmente - Currently
Aquí - Here
Allí - There
Casi - Almost
Solamente - Only
Realmente - Really
Cuidadosamente - Carefully
Especialmente - Especially
